alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Iron County through 245 PM CDT... At 230 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lac Du Flambeau, or 10 miles southeast of Turtle Flambeau Flowage, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Iron County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
